publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3494 Ms Sandra White: Volunteering and Disability—That the Parliament supports the work being undertaken by Volunteer Development Scotland (VDS) in its endeavours to encourage more disabled people to take up volunteering opportunities; notes its recent report, Volunteering and Disability, which revealed that disabled people are far more likely than other volunteers to undertake support and service provision roles such as befriending; further notes that the internet is not as widely utilised as it could be in terms of a route into volunteering for disabled people due to inaccessible volunteering websites; supports VDS’s recommendations, in particular that volunteering organisations should ensure that staff dealing with volunteers or prospective volunteers have had disability equality training and are aware of means in which reasonable adjustments can be made to be inclusive.
S2M-3494 Volunteering and Disability (lodged on 31 October 2005) Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-3494 Volunteering and Disability (lodged on 31 October 2005) Alex Neil*, Donald Gorrie*
